page.title: 19A PRIMARY SCHOOL, HARROW.
page.content: The building was originally a boys' boarding school until taken over in 1969 by{St.Teresa's, Hatch End.}Now, it is one of the 55 primary schools in Harrow. The ages range from 3 to 12 years and the subjects include Science, French, Home Economics, Craft and Fabrics. The school recently obtained a computer. Soon, the school will move and the site will be used for housing and recreation. There is no 11+ exam in Harrow and the children move onto 1 of the 11 high schools. Changes in teaching have given each child more attention, responsibility and varied activities in classes of 25 pupils. Mr. Forcer, headmaster of St. Teresa's qualified after taking the Matriculation exam and a 2 year teaching course. Today, a teacher needs 2 A-levels and a degree.
